title: Getting error when checking "brownie --version"
body:
I installed brownie via pipx but when I check the brownie version using "brownie --version", I get the follow errror:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/bin/brownie", line 5, in <module>
    from brownie._cli.__main__ import main
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/_cli/__main__.py", line 7, in <module>
    from brownie import network
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/__init__.py", line 4, in <module>
    from .account import Accounts
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/account.py", line 37, in <module>
    from .rpc import Rpc
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/rpc/__init__.py", line 16, in <module>
    from brownie.network.state import Chain
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/state.py", line 20, in <module>
    from brownie.project.build import DEPLOYMENT_KEYS
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/project/__init__.py", line 3, in <module>
    from .main import (  # NOQA 401
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/project/main.py", line 45, in <module>
    from brownie.network.contract import (
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/contract.py", line 40, in <module>
    from brownie.project import compiler, ethpm
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/project/ethpm.py", line 20, in <module>
    from brownie.typing import AccountsType, TransactionReceiptType
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/typing.py", line 3, in <module>
    from brownie.network.account import Accounts
ImportError: cannot import name 'Accounts' from partially initialized module 'brownie.network.account' (most likely due to a circular import) (/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/account.py)


AND

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/bin/brownie", line 5, in <module>
    from brownie._cli.__main__ import main
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/__init__.py", line 6, in <module>
    from brownie.project import compile_source, run
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/project/__init__.py", line 3, in <module>
    from .main import (  # NOQA 401
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/project/main.py", line 44, in <module>
    from brownie.network import web3
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/__init__.py", line 4, in <module>
    from .account import Accounts
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/account.py", line 37, in <module>
    from .rpc import Rpc
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/rpc/__init__.py", line 16, in <module>
    from brownie.network.state import Chain
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/state.py", line 23, in <module>
    from .transaction import TransactionReceipt
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/brownie/network/transaction.py", line 15, in <module>
    import black
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/black/__init__.py", line 13, in <module>
    import regex as re
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/regex/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from .regex import *
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/regex/regex.py", line 419, in <module>
    import regex._regex_core as _regex_core
  File "/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/regex/_regex_core.py", line 21, in <module>
    import regex._regex as _regex
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-38-darwin.so, 2): no suitable image found.  Did find:
	/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-38-darwin.so: code signature in (/Users/usamasiddiqui/Library/Python/3.8/lib/python/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-38-darwin.so) not valid for use in process using Library Validation: Trying to load an unsigned library



Brownie seems to not working on my macbook. Any help?
I have:
Python version: 3.8.2
Ganache-CLI version: 6.12.2
i have the same problem, did you managed to solve it?
